definition: formation (of a sports team, troops etc)
disposition of troops/wave/spate/burst/spell/short period of time/classifier for events or states of short duration

sentences.english: I think they were not using the right tactics and formations.
sentences.chinese: 我覺得他們的戰術和陣型都有問題。

sentences.english: The fleets then squared off against one another in the course of a weekend.
sentences.chinese: 一星期結束，所有艦隊將擺開陣型，捉對交戰。

sentences.english: The different roles of wide players in Chelsea's 4-3-3.
sentences.chinese: 在切爾西的433陣型中，邊路球員扮演過不同角色。

sentences.english: Germany also only had one man up front: Klose (11).
sentences.chinese: 德國在陣型最前方也只有11號克洛澤一人。

sentences.english: It is not that one formation is necessarily better than another.
sentences.chinese: 這並不意味着一個陣型必然強於另一個。

sentences.english: There is a difference between a shield wall, with overlapping shields and merely close-order.
sentences.chinese: 盾牌相互重疊的盾牆和單純的緊密陣型是不同的。

sentences.english: Maitain the distance between us, make the whole team move like a whole body.
sentences.chinese: 保持位置之間的距離，儘量使陣型整體移動。

sentences.english: After array shape estimation error was corrected, the algorithm yielded higher precision of source localization.
sentences.chinese: 在修正陣型估計誤差後，進一步提高算法的定位精度。

sentences.english: Many describe the tactic as a 4-2-2-2.
sentences.chinese: 很多人都將這陣型定義爲4222。

sentences.english: This was the tournament that confirmed the decline of the 4-4-2.
sentences.chinese: 這證實了世界盃賽上442陣型的沒落。

definition: to open fire/to shoot a gun
to speak forcefully and with justice (idiom); to argue with the courage of one's convictions
to be out of form/not to be oneself
"The Ugly Duckling" by Hans Christian Andersen 安徒生[An1 tu2 sheng1]
to amuse oneself/to play with/to tease
